dt: {bc}to act as {d_link|arbiter|arbiter} upon (a disputed question) {bc}to settle (a dispute between two people or groups) after hearing the arguments and opinions of both
{bc}to submit or refer for decision to an arbiter

dt.t: The council will {wi}arbitrate{/wi} among the interest groups.

et: borrowed from Latin {it}arbitrātus{/it}, past participle of {it}arbitrārī{/it} "to consider, judge, decide," verbal derivative of {it}arbitr-, arbiter{/it} "onlooker, {et_link|arbiter|arbiter}"
shortdef: to act as arbiter upon (a disputed question) : to settle (a dispute between two people or groups) after hearing the arguments and opinions of both
to submit or refer for decision to an arbiter
